SEARCH
Module panther.pantherii
Package panther.pantherii

Class Kinematic

java.lang.Object
panther.pantherii.Kinematic
public class Kinematic extends Object
This class represents the kinematic model of a robot. It uses three ServoMoteur objects to control the robot's movements. The robot's position is controlled by two sliders, one for the x-axis and one for the y-axis.

  • Constructor Details

    • Kinematic

      public Kinematic(ArrayList<ServoMoteur> servos, double[] dims, javafx.scene.control.Slider xslider, javafx.scene.control.Slider yslider)
      Constructor for the Kinematic class. Initializes the servo motors, segment lengths, and sliders.
      Parameters:
      servos - An ArrayList of ServoMoteur objects.
      dims - An array of doubles representing the lengths of the robot's segments.
      xslider - A Slider object to control the robot's x-axis movement.
      yslider - A Slider object to control the robot's y-axis movement.

  • Method Details

    • home

      Resets the robot to its home position.

    • checkFor

      private void checkFor()
      Checks if the robot is moving forward or backward.

    • checkUp

      private void checkUp()
      Checks if the robot is moving up or down.

    • setAngles

      private void setAngles(boolean isX)
      This method calculates and sets the angles of the servo motors based on the robot's position. It first checks if the robot is moving up, down, forward, or backward. Then, it calculates the hypotenuse and the angles 'a' and 'b' using trigonometric functions and the law of cosines. If the calculated angles are not a number (NaN), it adjusts the x and y coordinates accordingly. Finally, it sends the calculated angles to the servo motors.
      Parameters:
      isX - A boolean value that indicates whether the x-axis position is being set. If true, the x-axis position is being set. If false, the y-axis position is being set.

    • sendAngles

      private void sendAngles()
      Sends the calculated angles to Websocket.

    • offset

      public void offset(double angle)
      Adjusts the offset of the wrist up and down position. The offset is added to the angle 'c' of the robot.
      Parameters:
      angle - A double representing the angle by which to adjust the robot's wrist up and down position.
